content.description:
2 H2O2(aq) → 2 H2O(l) + O2(g)        ΔH° = −196 kJ/molrxn

The decomposition of H2O2(aq) is represented by the equation above. A student monitored the decomposition of a 1.0 L sample of H2O2(aq) at a constant temperature of 300. K and recorded the concentration of H2O2 as a function of time. The results are given in the table below.
content.question: Assume that the bond enthalpies of the oxygen-hydrogen bonds in H2O are not significantly different from those in H2O2 . Based on the value of ΔH° of the reaction, which of the following could be the bond enthalpies (in kJ/mol) for the bonds broken and formed in the reaction?

choices.label:
O–O in H2O2
    O=O in O2   
         O–H        

300
 500
 500

O–O in H2O2
    O=O in O2   
         O–H

    O=O in O2   
         O–H        

500

O–O in H2O2
    O=O in O2   
         O–H

 300

content.answer:
O–O in H2O2
    O=O in O2   
         O–H        

150
 500
 500

skill.text: 5.F: Calculate, estimate, or predict an unknown quantity from known quantities by selecting and following a logical computational pathway and attending to precision (e.g., performing dimensional analysis and attending to significant figures).
